website_summaries.verdict: The best pair of LED conversion headlights for those looking for brighter lights.
pros: Lights shine at a bright 7,200 lumens with neutral, white tone
Effectively runs cooler than other headlight options due to aluminum construction
cons: Not compatible with some vehicles listed on product page

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend for headlights without projectors
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 sets of the exact same bulb. I installed in 2017 4Runner with projectors and they worked great much brighter than factory. So I decided to order them for 2009 Sierra without projectors and well the are horrible. The LEDs must be pointing up and down because I have several spots right in front of the car that do not even get light. I am going to replace them with HIDs. Would not recommend for headlights without projector lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit and have to pay for return.
customer_reviews.text: These definitely do not fit in a 2018 Grand Cherokee Altitude... And you have to pay to return it. Maybe they should have an accurate list of compatible vehicles, so people don't waste their time and money.
customer_reviews.author: dR Designs

customer_reviews.title: Fit = yes and no and no and yes - returns no
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 pair for my 2010 Volvo S40. The conversion said this model will work for the low and high. The low works perfect, besides for the annoying warning light/message that stays on now. The high will not fit into place, it is too large, but technically I suppose it would work, the connector seems to be compatible. As you send in the photo, the stock bulb is much smaller is a tight fit to get it. The is no way of getting in the new one. The seems to be no return option either.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Useless piece of LEDs, don't fit into 2014 Toyota 4Runner. Also smoke came out from one LED
customer_reviews.text: Their 3 year warranty is worthless. Their LEDs don't fit into my car (2014 Toyota 4Runner) and their answer to my problem was to give me $10. I've paid almost $90 and they want me to keep the LED and they will give me $10. Why should I keep those LED since they don't work on my car? Returned and went to a different brand. Update: Bought also the 9005 for the High Beams and the first time when installed the smoke came out from one of the two LEDs. This is the second set that I have problems with this brand. I'll never trust this brand and their 2-3 years warranty since they don't work out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Emyshor

customer_reviews.title: Not As Bright as the OEM Bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I installed these in just a few minutes with no issues at all in our 2018 Nissan Murano SL. My biggest issue with these are they aren't as bright as the OEM factory installed incandescent bulbs. Which totally defeats the purpose of this purchase. Since they aren't as bright, this makes my car less safe when driving at night. These were a total waste of time and money. I'm returning them for a full refund. Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Habu 1771

customer_reviews.title: 2015 Silverado will not fit
customer_reviews.text: I was interested in seeing a new light form my Chevy Silverado (2015) but couldn't make it happen. I cannot knock the quality of the lights, the appeared and felt like they were well made issue was that they don't fit into the socket! the diameter of the bulbs tips is larger then the diameter of the hole in the trucks light housing. So lights were returned I will need to try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: DMP2011

customer_reviews.title: Borderline dangerous on Jeep Grand Cherokee w. projector headlights
customer_reviews.text: While they look awesome installed and the light 5ft from the car is fantastic, the light output literally drops off a cliff and they're dangerous now that we've entered the dark season. I did read up on the issue with LED's in projector headlights after the fact and the general consensus is that it is a bad idea (not just on jeeps, but projector headlights in general). There's an excellent post on the (Toyota) Tacoma Forum where a guy have made several tests in a semi scientific way, just google "3rd Gen HID vs LED vs Halogen H11 projector headlights"
customer_reviews.author: MaLi

customer_reviews.title: meh, about the same as before
customer_reviews.text: easy to install, plug and play. very reliable, i have not had any issues with these at all. but they are not as bright as you think. if you are expecting day and night difference from your factory halogen, you will be disappointed. they are marginally brighter than factory halogen, just the color tone is much cooler towards the blue side. however, cheap lights usually have problem with focus and regulation, these ones work great, and they do not throw lights all over the place blinding other motorists.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Easy install on 2017 Honda Pilot
customer_reviews.text: Seriously can’t beat the price for what you get. You can’t even go wrong here. I would say these are really about twice as bright as the factory halogen, but the light is much smoother and a nice clear white color. Looks great on the 2017 Honda Pilot! I have the EXL which has the LED running lights, but they reserved the LED headlights for the Touring and Elite models, so the yellow halogen was goofy looking. I also added the matching LED fog lights, which are three time brighter than the OEM. Now it’s all legit, same color!
customer_reviews.author: AnotherOnlineSlacker

customer_reviews.title: Very happy, good quality lights
customer_reviews.text: I installed these about 2 months ago and so far so good. I drive 100 miles a day with my lights on all the time and they are working great. At night they are a huge improvement over the original halogen bulbs. I haven't had any issues with blinding other drivers. The fans on them are a bit loud, I can hear them inside the car when the engine is not running and the radio is off.
customer_reviews.author: C. Henn

customer_reviews.title: An Easy Upgrade.  Almost Too Easy
customer_reviews.text: We bought a used 2016 Honda Odyssey minivan. The lights were pretty yellow-orange and clearly needed to be replaced with new bulbs. I'd seen LEDs in the past, but the cheaper ones were too blue and didn't really put out much more light than the old Halogen lamps. These don't have that problem. Price point was great. The light color is white, not blue. Which is what we like. The installation took less than 10 minutes and was easy. I didn't even need to move the angle of the LEDs, they lined up properly with the plug-in. We have only used these for a few hours thus far. I'll try to update later. But first impression is highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tony H.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t install in projector housings.
customer_reviews.text: Just a heads up. After installing these in my low beam projector housing headlights, I was really disappointed that these were actually very dim and did not light the road well. However, in my fog lights, these same bulbs performed really well. It turns out that LED bulbs don’t perform well in projector housing, but perform nicely in old school reflectors. I’m returning the set in the projectors because they simply aren’t safe because they don’t light the road well. It doesn’t have anything to do with the wattage of the bulb, it’s the design of all LED bulbs that prevent them from performing well in that situation.
customer_reviews.author: eevans004

customer_reviews.title: Been a year since purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have had just the headlights for 1 year on my 2006 4Runner, I was skeptical about them as the tech and aftermarket world for these are fairly new. I have been extremely happy, they are incredible, they light up road signs way down the road in complete darkness, I see everything perfectly, I plugged them right in, 5 min install. I chose the cool white. I am now going to buy the fog and high beams to complete the set, no flashing, no dimming, no issues, just quality product that has been through 1 hurricane, Florida summers 100 plus degrees , rain, and many night drives from Tampa to the panhandle.
customer_reviews.author: Lobsterboy1984

customer_reviews.title: Bright but flawed. Bright everywhere except further down the road where you need it.
customer_reviews.text: They are bright but the light seems to scatter rather than focus down the road. I love the color. I also noticed a cat eye effect (ring of light with no light in center) in the projector headlamp of my 2008 4runner. My guess is because a traditional halogen bulb emits light in every direction whereas these only emit light in two directions. I have a feeling this is why the light is bright to the sides but not so much down the road. These would be great if only they could fix the light scatter of these bulbs. When these die, I'll likely go back to traditional or install hid.
customer_reviews.author: D. Adame

customer_reviews.title: Lights are amazing, but don't fit my 2016 F150
customer_reviews.text: The lights work very well, but on my 2016 F150, they don't fit. If these fit in your car, buy them as they are amazing. The heat sink is too big and I had to adjust my light to shoot straight out for them to fit. I just bought the ones from FULGAR and I am trying them. I admit, the CougarMotor ones are incredible lights. They are white, bright, and very even. The FULGARS are not nearly as good. I threw these CougarMotor lights in my wife's care where they fit and they are incredible lights.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Bright light
customer_reviews.text: Cons: -Works great -Bright Light -looks like an oem HID or LED headlight -small enough to fit in my 2017 Tahoe's headlight housing with the protective cap on Cons: -when light is produced, since there are 2 leds (one on each side) when looking at the headlight itself, you can see the light on 2 sides of the projector which looks a little weird. Should have just put another led dead center facing straight out, but I'm not an engineer -when I was installing the light, the headlight came loose and was spinning freely when I was locking it into place. (No I didn't over tighten). That is the reason for the loss of the star
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Just returned a different a different brand led ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Just returned a different a different brand led kit as it was weaker than my keychain flashlight. CougarMotor however works as advertised. It is very bright and white, installed very easily and fan noise while it can be heard is not loud. Also the attached decoder box or ballast is small enough to be tucked in. I have a 2004 Prius which originally came with cheap Phillips halogens. My review could change if the light burns out or something but right now I am highly recommending it. I could replace my high beams too but with these led low beams, you won't need to ever use high beams.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: 30w per bulb, not 60 w
customer_reviews.text: So I wanted these bulbs because I like the 6000k color temperature. This upgraded version is more compact, but honestly, it looks like the fans grille is just removed. The LED housing looks a little different too. As you can see from the pics, it looks like there's no ballast involved anymore, which is always nice. However, I was a little upset to find out that the 60w claim made actually means that each bulb is 30w, and the combination of the 2 equals 60w, which is kind of a rip. If you read the details of the product before you even buy, you'll find that info, but just be aware of that.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Lights At A Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: These lights were exactly what I was looking for! It bothered me that all of the running lights on my '16 Civic were LED but the low beams were halogen so I decided to change over to these and what a difference it made. They're practically brighter than my high beams and the blue color is much more satisfying. Installation took 15 minutes, and was pretty self explanatory. Overall, great product and I'm very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Austin E.

customer_reviews.title: 2015 ram 1500
customer_reviews.text: do not work as advertised, lights turn off every time within 5 minutes, invest and get name brand units
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright but not blinding.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2012 4WD Honda Pilot EX and these bulbs work great for the low beams. The install took a while because of the location of the stuff behind the headlights but, if they last as long as advertised, it should be the last time I have to do this. These are bright but not blinding.
customer_reviews.author: beechridge

customer_reviews.title: Not bright enough
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are bright to look at but they have significant scatter. Even compared to standard halogen bulbs, these bulbs cause significant night blindness especially if there is rain. At one point, I was unable to see anything on the road and was almost in a wreck. On dry roads, these lights are fine. Add anything to the road that soaks in light, they are useless. For this reason, I do not recommend this product. A Halogen or HID bulb outperforms them. They are cool looking and somewhat durable but looking past this, these bulbs are NOT safe to use on the highway.
customer_reviews.author: ak47u

customer_reviews.title: Worth a shot
customer_reviews.text: The Good: Easy install. Very nice, white light. No flickering, good beam pattern that doesn't seem blind other drivers. The Okay: Whiter than the factory headlights, but not noticeably brighter (if brighter at all) The Bad: One headlight will blink off at random. Might be after 3 minutes of driving or 30. When it is colder outside, both will shut off at random. This is after one week of ownership. The lights turning off at random is a deal breaker/safety issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H.

customer_reviews.title: Misleading - Not nearly as bright as what is promised
customer_reviews.text: I bought these bulbs for my girlfriend's son's car thinking they would be a big improvement in terms of how bright they are compared to the factory lights he has. I knew that 10000 lumens (5000 per light) would be a significant amount of "bright light" so that's why I bought these. Once they were installed they didn't seem to be as bright as what I thought. We just bought 100 watt LED bulbs for our garage and I know they are 1600 lumens of brightness. When I realized the headlights didn't seem that much brighter I had a friend measure the brightness and his device said they were half as bright as what is promised!! Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headlights
customer_reviews.text: These things are awesome, the pic shows the difference in color. They really light up the road. Highly recommend. These are installed in a BMW 320i XDrive. I liked them so much I bought a set for my 05 Volvo XC90. They work great also, just had to get the CANBUS decoder so the "low beam failure" indicator light would stop coming on. Cougar sent the CANBUS at no extra charge. Very happy with their customer service. I emailed them several times asking questions and they usually returned my email in minutes. You won't be unhappy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from stock halogen on 2011 Chevy Silverado
customer_reviews.text: Perfect on my 11 silverado. Install wasn’t bad, had to remove the two top headlight bolts to get enough room to pull headlight forward and to twist in. The passenger side I had to unplug the afm sensor and lift the whole intake assembly, then the two head light bulbs. I first installed one bulb in first to compare the beam pattern to stock halogen. A mark was made on the garage door as the beam is higher than stock. After adjusting the lights aimed great no hot spots on the light output. No flashing from on coming drivers and they are bright!
customer_reviews.author: Darrickmang

customer_reviews.title: Love these headlights
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about these initially. I’ve read mixed reviews on here saying sometimes they would flicker or shut off. It’s been almost 6 months and I have had ZERO problems with them. I took them on a 20 hour road trip to Montana and countless trips up north and absolutely love these lights. I can see everything on the back roads and they really reflect the eyes off of animals. These were a bit snug in my 2012 tundra, I did have to loosen the headlight a bit to get it in. Make sure you do your research in what size bulbs to get.
customer_reviews.author: tomas

customer_reviews.title: *Updated review Please Read*
customer_reviews.text: (Original Review) "1 star - DOES NOT FIT 2013 HYUNDAI GENESIS COUPE AS ADVERTISED" *Update* The amazon fit system is not 100% accurate so I purchased these "headlights" thinking they would fit but they were actually fog lights for my vehicle, and very displeased I placed a review; within a day a customer service representative named Emma reached out to me. She apologized for the inconvenience and offered me a Free Replacement for the headlights I originally wanted. Its something she definitely didn't have to-do or offer to me, but it really made this whole situation turn around in a positive way. I'm very thankful to her and her customer service skills.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Seijo

customer_reviews.title: Clear white lights
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these lights as a gift for a 2009 lexus is250. The installation was fairly simple and the lights fit well (I got low and high beam). After installation, the lights flickered some but so far have been fine. They are a very clear white and shine brightly. No negative effects so far. I only gave 3 stars for longevity because I’ve only had them in for a couple of days. Everything else is 5 stars. Solid purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Make sure these actually FIT your vehicle!
customer_reviews.text: Product looked fine...in the box! Item description said they were a direct fit for my 2016 Dodge Grand Caravan. Light was good, no flicker. When it came time to install them, I discovered that the locking lugs on the LED lamps were TOO THICK! Hense, I was unable to install the product. If I were to modify the product, warranty would be void...if I modified the headlight housing, warranty would also be voided. Was a real bummer too. Light output was excellent. Refund was quick and easy. Recommendations: try to install the bulbs FIRST. Do not rely on seller incorrect info.
customer_reviews.author: William D

customer_reviews.title: Can you see at night 🤔 Maybe not
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2011 Chevy impala police package and these lights changes things from stock to these I will never be able to settle for less these lights really lives up to their advertisement. If you think your stock hid or halogen bulb are bright think again I can’t believe how powerful these lights are for the quality price and easy install you can’t beat it. Only tip I will give you far as installing is if the lights don’t work once you install switch the direction of the plug and try again. NO HIGH-BEAMS IN THE PHOTO REGULAR RUNNING LIGHTS
customer_reviews.author: jaiquan frazier

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love the Cougar Motor LED bulbs. This is my 5th set, 2016 Malibu headlights, 2006 Sequoia headlights and fog lights and 2014 Silverado high beams and fog lights all worked great without any issues. The set for my 2014 Silverado low beams flickered and wouldn't stay on because of the DRL system. Cougar sent me decoders free of charge no questions asked and that fixed the problem. Thank you Cougar! If you have covers on the back of your headlights make sure you have room to stuff all the wiring in there, or be willing to leave the covers off (not recommended).
customer_reviews.author: Karla Cook

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in June for a 2006 Honda Pilot. From unboxing to installed & lit may have taken 10 minutes if that long. I wanted to wait several months to review to get a sense of durability & brightness. So far these LED headlights are excellent. They turn on instantly and illuminate well in all driving conditions. Light obviously is a crisp bright white light -- much better than the soft yellowish glow of the many incandescent lights I had used previously in this car. Frankly these were cheaper than the Ultra incandescents we had used previously. Will continue to update if or when reliability changes but these LED lamps far exceed expectations. Strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nom de plume ebubman

customer_reviews.title: not as good as i thought!
customer_reviews.text: they are no where as bright as I thought they would be...the throw they put out are terrible on my low beams in my 2017 Tacoma ..and I received a set with the end cap missing but the set I put In my low beams were fine I bought 3 pair and sent one pair back not bad in high beams and fog lights just suck in low beams and I tried adjusting the lights but still did not have any kind of throw to them
customer_reviews.author: Micky F.

customer_reviews.title: Brightness and coverage was greatly increased over original bulbs as long as properly adjusted
customer_reviews.text: Bulbs & adapters fit in housing & the covers even fit back on housing (2015 Impala Limited). (no experience on longevity as I just installed them but they need better instructions on how to adjust bulbs/lights properly or you may be disappointed in performance. I was when I first installed them, but after properly alignment of bulbs themselves inside the housing and then the height, my headlights have greatly increased coverage/brightness to see down the road as well as off the side in ditches ( much, much better than original bulbs)
customer_reviews.author: clfplvw

customer_reviews.title: Good looks and great tech
customer_reviews.text: Love the look. Easy to install and bright, but not blinding. They are a nice middle ground between standard halogen bulbs and HID headlights. Having current tech in an older mid-tier trim level car brings more value to my car. Giving them 4 stars since it wasn't obvious that I needed decoders in addition to the bulbs for my vehicle and the bulb-decoder package barely fit into the housing for the headlight. Granted, every car is different. Maybe future versions will have the decoder integrated and miniaturized.
customer_reviews.author: Randy M.

customer_reviews.title: Really great upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I just installed these in my 2014 Toyota Camry XLE. Installation was very easy, taking no more than 10 minutes and exactly as described in the videos readily available here and elsewhere. I have other vehicles with factory LED headlights and while I was hopeful the Cougar upgrade would be close to those, I am really blown away by the tremendous improvement these are over the stock halogen bulbs. I cannot speak to longevity and will update this review if there are issues, but the improved visibility alone makes these an outstanding value! I regret I did not take before and after pictures.
customer_reviews.author: C. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation & Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I agonized for months over changing my low beam lamps to LED or HID in our 2010 Honda Insight. I worried about the fit, beam pattern and possible difficulties in the installation. Well, I should have done this months ago! It took just minutes and the pattern is the same. The light is white and much brighter. This was done three days ago but so far so good! Update: This little Honda is not a quiet car but the fan noise is definitely noticeable!
customer_reviews.author: LeoInYakima

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, now flickering.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, came quick, packaged professionally and very bright. Actually going with same company for my fogs! Highly recommended! ***UPDATE*** Bulbs have been flickering to the point where I have been pulled over by the local police because they thought they were strobes. What started out as a great product is now proving to be a failing product.
customer_reviews.author: Austin P

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are awesome! Super bright, great color! Just as good as the hids in my other car. These will be in every future suv/truck I own.
customer_reviews.author: Bennjamine B.

customer_reviews.title: Working Well - after one week of use
customer_reviews.text: Installed in a 2007 Buick LaCrosse, there is barely enough room to place ballast and light unit in the enclosed compartment (screw-on back plate). I'm not sure how the cooling fan is going to provide adequate cooling in that small space, but it's working at the present time (cooler outside). Very bright white light. I'll be happy if it lasts through the summer heat, and am relying on the three year warranty if it fails. I'm cautiously optimistic about these lights.
customer_reviews.author: hst

customer_reviews.title: Perfect on 2007 Chevy Tahoe
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy (as long as you have the extra clearence) and they are super bright and aim perfect. Installed in my 2007 Chevy Tahoe, and the passenger side was very tight but worked.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great Lights!
customer_reviews.text: I've had quite of few pairs of headlights through the years from various halogens, HID kits, etc. I've never gone LED, and since I noticed I had a blown headlight the other day, I decided now was the time to try LEDs. These fit SO much better than HIDs did, and these are significantly brighter. I got used to the poor visual from my old halogen bulbs, but these are powerful enough to make me think I have my high beams on when I actually don't. Great Lights, great fit, and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Garry Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Love these lights!
customer_reviews.text: Love these lights. Wasn't sure if they would work so well but in the end I'm glad I made the change. Was strange that a vehicle manufacturer like Cadillac would use halogen lights in some models and HID in others. Why not always use the same. In the end I didn't like the yellowish light plus the dimmed output of my OE Halogen bulbs. I wanted to have that bluish/white color of HID but without the high cost. These bulbs offer that. I will put these bulbs in each of my vehicles when its time to change the headlights!
customer_reviews.author: Nitemare90

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Minor changes needed.
customer_reviews.text: Fits 2016 Honda Civic EX-L nicely. I did give this product a 4/5 start for install. The process to less that 15 minutes as you only needed to take the old bulb out and replace with this one. However, the plastic base did not fit in the notches during install. I had to cut off approx. 1/8inch to make it fit for both bulbs. The rotating base seemed to be most peoples gripe which i believe was fixed as i couldn't rotate it at all. Seems as though they take feedback seriously. I hope this finds its way to manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Nice headlights
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my 2010 Toyota Prius. No flickering. The are bright. The fan noise is noticeable from inside the car, but only when you are stationary and the radio is off (think when you park and turn off the car). The noise is only a slight hum which does not sound too different than the electric motor. I got them more for the long life that is promised. I will update review once they stop working.
customer_reviews.author: swede96

customer_reviews.title: 4stars rating
customer_reviews.text: Pro: the headlights are crazy bright and worth the money. Con: the instructions are not that great. I could not install the headlights because the tip of the light was bigger than the opening of my housing. I was very frustrated that I couldn’t use. It took some Googling and researching on the net to find out that the nut in the front could be removed. After removing it, I realized that it was only there for esthetic and served no other purpose. After removing that nut, the instillation went smoothly. I spent an hour on something which should have been included in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Victor V

customer_reviews.title: They are just okay
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had LEDs before. These aren’t as bright, as they should be.. Beams aren’t very controlled. Worst of all plug says which sides are positive and negative. Well the plug is flipped. So to make them work the plug goes in the wrong way. Can’t lock it in. Had to use zip ties to make sure they don’t come unplugged. Like hello quality control? Got them to replace the ones my mechanic ruined. old LEDs (other brand, more expensive) were better. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: order the right ones ask your mechanic for help
customer_reviews.text: they are very bright . I had bought a set from another company that I had to return because one of the wires were loose. the replacement set worked well until one of the low beams broke so I ordered these but they came with the wrong size socket then the next came with the wrong plug. My mechanic had a drawer full of those Cougar motor headlight bulbs and he sold me the one I needed. I will always let my mechanic order my parts. And I gave up trying to get Bulbs for my reverse lights .
customer_reviews.author: Steven Keogh

customer_reviews.title: Freakin awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 2013 prius since one of the lights went out. I just went ahead and replaced them both with this. We had the "normal" lights, and OMGosh! These lights are SO AWESOME! I even want to replace the bulbs in ALL my vehicles with this, but I feel like it's a waste to just throw out perfectly good bulbs! But it might be worth it! Ok, just for my truck, I'll do that... Anyway, HUGE difference, couldn't recommend it more! Ever wonder why some ppl's lights shine more light? Well, they have these.
customer_reviews.author: Redhatzeno

customer_reviews.title: CR-V 2017 - very happy
customer_reviews.text: 2017 Honda CR-V. Bought the low beams (H11). No problem (plug and play) installation (just a little wiggling on the driver's side), but if you are looking to buy replacement bulbs, you can do it easily. Light is very bright and wide, but cuts off without blinding oncoming drivers. I am now buying the high beams. No fan sounds that I can hear. Good value (particularly compared to costs for Touring model).
customer_reviews.author: MacIvey

customer_reviews.title: Not all you would expect and labor intensive install
customer_reviews.text: These lights were the most difficult to make work. 07 suburban had to cut a notch out of a support piece behind the head light. They also can be connected wrong. They should be made to only plug in the correct way. Also, not impressed at all with the light. Yes they are really bright, but the light is so spread out it is actually less road visible than stock. I'm sure if these wer installed in projectors they would be great beams and bright. Also these things get HOTT I really hope they dont burn out or worse... cause damage. They do have fans but no telling till they have some time to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, dependable, bright
customer_reviews.text: I have these installed on my 2020 Nissan rogue and they are spectacular. The focus of the light seems to be so that it hits just below the back window of the car in front of me. As always, the light is bright and I have become use to actually being able to see in the dark ever since I installed the first set on my last car. Last car being a 2006 Subaru impreza, the lights were still going strong over a year after they were installed and the low beams are the daytime running lights. Good product, will order again if/when they burn out.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Instant Full Brightness and Steady
customer_reviews.text: I got these LEDs for my 2016 Chrysler Town and Country. Installing was easy, just plug and play. However, Chryslers have a problem detecting the LEDs and sending a constant voltage. The lights flicker and strobe. I contacted Cougar Motors and they immediately sent out a pair of FREE decoders. LEDs now work perfectly. After 30 minutes of run time in park, the decoders are still cool to the touch, and the drivers are hot, but not worryingly hot. I would definitely recommend, and if you have a Chrysler, contact Cougar for a set of decoders.
customer_reviews.author: W. Plante

customer_reviews.title: Brighter then expected
customer_reviews.text: Got these in the mail quickly. Hesitated to put them on because of some of the reviews. Put them on in less then 5 minutes. Got up the next morning to go to work and was pleasantly surprised at how bright they were. Nice clean bright light. In fact I couldn't see much difference in the brightness from the old lights to the new but it was so much clearer. The old lights cost me $45 each and weren't lasting a year. I got 2 of these for less then one of them and I will probably not have to worry about them burning out. Good Deal!
customer_reviews.author: Randy W. P.

customer_reviews.title: H11 lasted less than 24 hrs
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2019 Ram Classic. I ordered H11, 9005 and fogs. I installed the fogs first they worked and looked great. Afterwards I installed the high and low beams testing after every install. They looked great the FIRST day. I came out the very next morning to show a friend and the H11 flashed on once. I tried a second time they flashed a second time one at a time and then went out completely. I don’t know how long the other bulbs will last but I i will not be purchasing again!
customer_reviews.author: Kerrie Swearingen

customer_reviews.title: Must have over halogen anyday.
customer_reviews.text: Dramatically improved visibility over oem halogen. i have a 2018 traverse redline and it has led projection lights and i fell in love with night time driving. recently bouggt a 2009 impala for work and the night driving was bad i purchased newer 50.00 bulbs from store and still cant hold a candle to led. they look like my traverse lights. i love them so much i will be ordering 3 more sets for my other vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: pcchevy21

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding! Works great with Mercedes CLK-350 onboard computer!
customer_reviews.text: These CougarMotor bulbs work perfectly on a 2009 Mercedes CLK-350 with no additional computer error canceling add-ons. I ordered these CougarMotor LED bulbs because I returned Magneti Marelli LED bulbs that were not compatible with the onboard computer without additional resistors. The light output is outstanding and the color is a typical factory LED color you see on new cars.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: Best lights I’ve ever installed
customer_reviews.text: First thing I had noticed was the smaller size of these compared to the older version, which makes it that much easier to maneuver into tight places. The new design is flawless. I did t think they could possibly be any brighter than my other ones but wow what a difference these are extremely bright and have no problem seeing anything at night. Theses are no doubt the best lights I have ever installed in a vehicle. Would buy these over and over again. Definite must have for anyone that drives at night.
customer_reviews.author: Mark LaPlante

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in my 2019 Toyota Tacoma!
customer_reviews.text: These worked great in my Toyota Tacoma. The color temperature is 100% better than the sickly yellow stock bulbs. For low beams, they seem to be more than bright enough and are an improvement over stock. I haven't tried these in the high beams, though I'm considering it, since the high beams are also a sickly yellow. Makes the front of the truck look a million times better, as well, with a nice bright white light instead of the yellow bulbs. Pretty easy installation - I would buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Not only see much better ahead but also to the sides as well
customer_reviews.text: Intense bright white lite. 2.5 to 3 times brighter than original headlights which were dangerously dim, even when new. Not only see much better ahead but also to the sides as well. The problem.is they are to bright. After adjusting the LED's downward 3 times and still get the occasional driver flashing their high beams at me. I also am experiencing bright LED headlights in my eyes as the number of cars with these super bright lights increase. Also my car is a plugin hybrid, and as an added benefit , the electricity needed for the LED's is a fraction of what the halogen's used.
customer_reviews.author: JWHow

customer_reviews.title: Amazing improvement in my 2019 Dodge Grand Caravan
customer_reviews.text: I swapped these into my 2019 Grand Caravan, hoping for more/better light. All I can say is WOW! These are a nice crisp white, with no hint of blue that I could detect. I used a lumen app on my phone across the yard and here are the results. Stock halogen low beams - 33 Led low beams = 68 So, almost double the light output. I paired them with LED fog lights and the result is wonderful. They installed easily and I can hear the little fans purring.
customer_reviews.author: Brody Avalon

customer_reviews.title: Don't fit 2007-2014 tahoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for 2 of my vehicles. A 2018 jeep grand Cherokee and a 2007 chevy Tahoe. Installed perfectly on the jeep but they didn't fit the Tahoe due to the space behind the headlights not being big enough to fit the fan of the bulb. They are extremely bright that you can hardly tell the difference between them and HIDs.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Tee

customer_reviews.title: They worked, but they flickered.  Then the company sent me the decoders to fix it!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE** They sent me the decoders free of charge! Awesome company to work with! All good to go now, they are nice and bright too! They went right in with no issues on my Ram 1500, I had to customize and extend the high beam dust caps but that is understandable with the fan LEDs. The only issue I have so far is they flicker slightly, I don't want to have to buy additional components to stop the flickering when some LEDs come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dangerous D

customer_reviews.title: Good output, poor focus on 12' silverado
customer_reviews.text: I like the color and output of the lights, but the cut off has been raised so high in my 2012 silverado that I'm getting flashed by on coming traffic. If I lower the low beam to where it's tolerable, the highs hit not far out in front of me. In fact with the low beams on a wall at about 20 feet away, the highs shine right in the middle of the lows pattern. I thought I'd be able to get away with it but the lows just arnt focused down enough. Most likely going to return them and try a set of HIDs.
customer_reviews.author: James R.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely brighter.
customer_reviews.text: Well I bought these to replace my stock bulbs. Installation on my 07 Tundra was kind of a pain. They don't fit from the back like the normal bulbs. You have to take the headlight assembly out install the bulbs which only fit one direction so no adjustments can be made as to what placement the LEDs point. Yes they are bright you can definitely see better. Not sure if they're actually adjusted right for maximum visibility but they seem good.
customer_reviews.author: tweedter

customer_reviews.title: Simple, bright, rugged.
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered 2 sets of these and I'm very happy with the results. The first one went into my motorcycle (h4 hi/lo), the 2nd set went into my 2014 Toyota Highlander. In both cases these bulbs were far brighter and cast more light than the stock halogens. Plus they were rugged enough to survive 9 days off-road on my motorcycle in Baja. Super easy to install, no separate ballasts and wiring like HID requires. Just plugged them in. My only suggestion is to make them more compact, but I realize that's a limitation of the technology and cooling ability.
customer_reviews.author: Enduro_Dad

customer_reviews.title: Definitely NOT 200% Brightness as Stock Halogen Bulbs on 2015 Prius
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because we desired brighter low beams on our 2015 Prius. These are definitely NOT 200% brightness of the stock halogen bulbs. They may be brighter, but not twice as bright... Still couldn't see well while driving at night with these. Bought the Hikari Ultra ones, and they are BRIGHT!!! These ones (Cougar Motor) might be the right/maximum recommended brightness for a truck, where the light is projected from higher, to prevent blinding other drivers. The Hikari's are likely too bright for a higher vehicle, where these would likely be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: B. Aller

customer_reviews.title: Glad I read the reviews and went with these light bulbs!!!
customer_reviews.text: 1) I like that these b yiu lbs are at a good price...especially compared to anything you would pick up from the auto store!! 2) They were so so easy to put in. I am not a mechanic....and that's an understatement. I had these bulbs put in around 5 minutes. If they arent turning on...like with my case, they just have to be reversed because you may have the plug in reverse. 3) super bright and looks great. I love my car even more than I forst did with the factory halogen bulbs. They work....they are bright, easy plug and play and for a good price. There is no good reason to wait any longer. Get 'em!!
customer_reviews.author: Mello

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for 2015 Camaro LT
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these lights based on reviews, I originally was going to purchase different LED lights that were $149 a pair and I am so glad I went with these. They are amazing lights for the price and really brighten the road, although I have only had them on one day I didn't have anyone flash me because they were to bright. I will be purchasing more for my bright lights and fog lights. No issues at all fitting in my 2015 Camaro LT and so far no code error's. I will update review after 6 months use.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Knight

customer_reviews.title: Not good for projector headlights
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work on a '15 Subaru Legacy. It would only light up an area about 10ft from the bumper. From the driver's seat it looked like you only have fog lights on. I saw other people with projector headlights posting similar complaints but ordered them anyway, should've listened. I'd only consider these if you have reflector headlights (without the round lens that looks like a magnifying glass)
customer_reviews.author: Edmond Dantes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have put these on 3 different vehicles now after a recommendation from my cousin. These lights are absolutely awesome between the brightness and ease of install. Highly recommend. But please, be responsible and put these in only projector style lenses and not the old-school reflector housings. People that put LEDs in reflector headlights blind oncoming traffic because they have no beam cut-off. These lights are bright enough to be dangerous in reflector housing headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Christie Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Good product ,good customer service !
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived in good condition. Very easy to install. Really a plug and play item. 6000K is white with a very little shade of blue. I think 5000K is really the pure white. Very bright and no Radio interruptions encountered during use.I hope it will last long cause I'm satisfied with the product. The seller mailed some site if there is any problem in installing or if needs a return of the item. Good customer service. I would recommend to buy this item in this seller. My Camry 2014 looks better and brighter road ahead of me.....
customer_reviews.author: Eisenhower

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy for Hummer H2
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to fit on my '03 Hummer H2, but they do not fit in the enclosure, the wiring harness is wrong, and there is no way to make it work. Disappointing because i was excited about having LED headlights. the stock lights are woefully inadequate
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Tansek

customer_reviews.title: * The Best for dark streets
customer_reviews.text: Easy install in minutes. Lights are white with hint of cold blue hue, very pleasant calming color. This is more apparent on the white reflective lane deviders. Illuminates road signs from a far. On the road with cars around not significantly brighter however on the darker streets the lights are very bright with longer range then most plus wide angle, no need to use brights to illuminate dark zones. In addition, conventional bulbs made the plastic super hot but now it's cool to touch. Very pleased! Ordered one more set for other car.
customer_reviews.author: Labysus

customer_reviews.title: FUNCTIONALITY INCORRECT, ITEM DOES NOT WORK/FIT 2012 RAM 2500 LOW BEAM FIXTURE.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Bulbs to upgrade lighting on a 2012 Ram 2500 to LED, to better night driving and lengthen bulb life. That said, these bulbs, although said to work for specific vehicle, do not fit into fixture. Bulb length is too long for Low Beam Fixture. Had to return. Only gave 1 (one) star because I had to in order to submit comments. Additionally, I had to call and fight about getting my full refund. They initially shorted me $7.38 for not reason.
customer_reviews.author: Gundlach

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect on my 2016 F-150 headlights.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect on my 2016 F-150 headlights. Easy to install and definitely brighter than stock halogen bulbs which I prefer when ever I get a new truck. Only con is...When installed in the headlight housing, the back of the LED bulb does stick out about a quarter inch past the headlight housing, which does not allow the stock rubber weather cover to fit back on. I cut a hole in my rubber weather cover to accommodate the extra length of the LED bulb.
customer_reviews.author: MauiBoi59

customer_reviews.title: Better than Auxbeam
customer_reviews.text: bought these on July 5 2017. these were for a 2017 Tacoma TRD Offroad. Performance so far, is on point, ZERO issues. Plug and Play. Went thru THREE pairs of Auxbeams S4s, plus one warranty set...3 pairs failed within 30 days. The warranty pair were in the fog lights and finally failed 2 weeks ago. I will give Auxbeam credit to their customer service. They were responsive on the warranty with no issues. But quality is terrible on Auxbeams. All pairs failed in a power up situation, there was no flicker out or failure when on for a period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Hooked on Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Bright!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded the lights in my 2015 Ford F-150 FX4. These things are BRIGHT. The cooling fans on the lamp are much quieter than other LED style lamps I've used in the past. Many of the competitor lamps are somewhat noisy and will whine audibly even in the cockpit after engine shutdown. MIND THE POLARITY. The connector is a 'universal' and won't key to the Ford receptacle. You can plug these in backwards. There is a small tag on the cable extending from the new lamp, it states to check for plug orientation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not enough light output
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these based off reviews and recommendations on a forum I am on. They are absolutely horrible! I do not dare drive at night using these headlights as they do not produce near enough light to safely navigate the roads. We've YouTube'd to mage sure we didn't something wrong. We've adjusted them and still the lighting is awful. They also create a very loud hum.
customer_reviews.author: Nsmith0104

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable ? Defective?
customer_reviews.text: The assembly comes in two parts. The piece with the red O ring which locks into the headlight assembly on the car. The the fan/light part. The two parts slide and there is no way to lock the the light/fan assembly. My original bulbs are yellow and the new ones are white but brightness levels are close to the same.
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: NICE
customer_reviews.text: I like these lights. I don't knownthat I can see any further, but the light is now a clean white and there is more peripheral lighting which is nice. I have these in a 2015 silverado, they were rather tricky to get installed and get the dust caps back on but it can be done with a little perseverance. I cant speak on longevity as they've only been for a few days but, I will update this in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Really sharp, really bright, way better than stock halogen on my 17 kia sorento
customer_reviews.text: Super nice and sharp, really bright and 1000+, 4 star+ ratings on Amazon are proof enough to buy these! No installation extras, easy as unplug old light and plug these in that's it! First off I love my Sorento but damn they f'd up the lighting, they have really cool led strip lighting that goes about the regular low beam headlights, but they don't match because the low beam is halogen with a yellow tint and the led strip is bright white. The only f up on that car because I love it. These led's fix that issue and look AWESOME
customer_reviews.author: murdog

customer_reviews.title: These are quite bright low-beam headlamps
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my 2012 Camry. The self-install was easy (Thanks, Toyota. Thanks, YouTube) and the improved lighting makes a difference on those dark city streets with older, taller, spreading trees and few street lights. At first, I thought that there was a hole in the light as the beam moved away from my car but then I realized that I was seeing that are for the first time and also in a brighter, whiter (bluer?) light. Once I turned on my old high beams, I really understood how much improvement these lamps gave me.
customer_reviews.author: dDave

customer_reviews.title: Buy them for your truck, you won't regret it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Money well spent! I'm about to order some more of these. They made such a big difference compare to the old ones. So much brighter at night and if the headlights are adjusted correctly they are not blinding the passing or oncoming traffic. They are as bright as most small cars equipped with LED lights. I used them on my Freightliner Cascadia truck and I'm very happy! Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vadim Olari

customer_reviews.title: Bright and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The lights were super easy to install. Keep an eye on the +\- of the cable though. I originally thought I had installed it right but noticed one light hadn’t turned on. A quick rotation of the socket fixed the issue. I can’t speak to longevity as I barely installed them but I hope they last at full brightness for a while since LED lights don’t die but dim over time. The light is a bit soft when in wet driving conditions but I attribute that to just LEDs in general as compared to halogen bulbs. So far I’m satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great brand!
customer_reviews.text: Have had these for well over a year now. On top of that I also have this brand in my other car with no issues at all. I've had horrible luck with LED bulbs in the past but this brand has made me less skeptical about LED lights. I put these in the fog lights of my 2018 ford focus ST paired with yellow lens vinyl and I love it! Super bright! The picture you see is just the fog lights on
customer_reviews.author: jdsk8er98

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and quite bright
customer_reviews.text: Super bright, way better than my original bulbs that my 2018 Chevy Colorado came with. Check out that before and after. My garage’s lighting isn’t great so my phone camera may have exaggerated a little in the difference; but it really is significantly better. My only gripe is they are too big for the dust caps to go back on unless you dremel out a huge hole in the caps, but that pretty well defeats the whole purpose of the dust caps... Overall I highly recommend these to anyone looking for a good, bright set of LED bulbs for any vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Patriot 1776

customer_reviews.title: BRIGHT! But check your headlight aim!
customer_reviews.text: I had another set of LED headlamps in my Nissan LEAF and they worked well, until one went out. So, I went with Amazon's recommendation and tried these. The length of the shaft that holds the LED elements isn't quite as long as the older LED headlamp, so the aim is pretty significantly different. You may have to re-aim your headlights WAY down. The difference in shaft length is why this is a 4-star product, not a 5-star. Otherwise, it is insanely bright.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Gleason

customer_reviews.title: does not fit 2009 Chevrolet Tahoe
customer_reviews.text: gave 3 stars because product does have nice bright white color, not cheesy blue; and they were easy to install. I deducted 2 stars because the actual bulb device itself is too deep. It fits in the light housing as advertised, but because the back of the light is so bulky, the light housing with the bulb installed will not fit back into its proper location on the front of the car. I am returning the bulbs and ordering these:  These have a lower back profile, and are not as bulky. I would recommend other 2009 Chevy Tahoe owners do the same, as these lights will not fit.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Not Easy to Install but worth the effort!
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the installation of high beams (9005 for my 17 Highlander), this was not an easy task. Had to take the cover off and trim the plastic for the heatsink to go inside. Trimming is not easy unless you have some carving tools or smth like a Dremel. Going through the ordeal was worth it though, got much brighter lighting as well as the upclass look achieved.
customer_reviews.author: S. B. Y.

customer_reviews.title: Update on previous comment.
customer_reviews.text: Since GM's Lambda's platform is a little difficult to get into the headlights, found a shortcut to get the lights off without removing the thousands of screws, and taking off the bumper. One of the lights wasn't blown, wasn't connected correctly. The lights are really bright, and work like a charm. I take my previous comment bout the lights wasn't bright, and one blew. I thought I did it correct, and I didn't push it all the way in the clip. I'm a happy camper now! 😁
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: They do the job but they weren't as good as I'd hoped for
customer_reviews.text: Note: these were installed in 2016 Toyota Tacoma truck with reflector headlights. They do the job but they weren't as good as I'd hoped for. The beam doesn't seem to be as effective as the stock units in the distance department. The stock bulbs seem to give a straighter, longer throw. These LED's give a wider pattern close up. When being used at highway speeds, they just don't seem to be that great.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 2015 Ford F-150 XLT.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 2015 Ford F-150 and while I bought the correct bulb for my truck, they did not fit the headlight housing. Even after trimming the headlight to accommodate the led, the weather seal cap did close because the led bulged out too much.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: They look fantastic. The lighting is perfect
customer_reviews.text: I put these in a 2012 Honda Insight as a low beam replacement. They look fantastic. The lighting is perfect. I do a lot of night driving and I was afraid that they would be too bright for oncoming traffic. I leave for work when it’s dark and I come home in the dark. However after having them in just over a week now not one single person has flashed their high beams at me so I know I’m not blinding oncoming traffic.
customer_reviews.author: travis bennett

customer_reviews.title: Flickering is Bad
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why these flicker as much as they do but its pretty irritating to see. Checked connections and everything is fine, tight, and dry. No reason for these to flicker as badly as they do but they do.
customer_reviews.author: Mobius

customer_reviews.title: Great product !
customer_reviews.text: I trusted many positive reviews and I order and installed on my 2017 Honda CRV. starting with order this product to installing , was a good experience. Presentation is a top class, product look modern and well done. I cannot have a long time reviews, because I just installed , but all process was a breeze , and cannot be more easy:simply remove the original bulbs and replace with the new one and Voila ! Thank you for making such a good product. Wish the bulbs to function for a long time. Please with the brighting and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Florida

customer_reviews.title: Very good product.
customer_reviews.text: I think those are the best LED lights I've ever used/tried. I installed them on toyota camry. They are very good! exact fit with no CAN issues at all. They worked very good with no complains! They truly are water resist. I'd buy again any time. Used them for many many hours till now and still no issues at all. Even when they really got in high water...
customer_reviews.author: S. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Easy install. Good performance!
customer_reviews.text: Jan 13, 2020 Update. Theses bulbs are still working and performing great. Last winter we had several -20 degree F days as well as 100 degree summer days, these bulbs worked Everytime. I highly recommend them. Im coming up on a month with this LED kit. Overall I'm satisfied with my purchase. The beam is is definitely brighter than the stock halogen bulbs. Not as bright as I though it would be but still better. Installation was very straight forward and I just used a few zip ties to secure the LED driver. Now only time will tell the lifespan of this kit. I would recommend this over a comparable halogen set if you have projector lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Rogue
customer_reviews.text: This product (h11) did not work in my 2017 Nissan rogue without projectors. Installation was easy did it in 5 minutes but the beam pattern is non existent. It's more like a high beam now.
customer_reviews.author: Arturo

product_meta.title: Cougar Motor LED Headlight Bulbs All-in-One Conversion Kit - H11 (H8, H9) -10000Lm 6000K Cool White CREE
feature_bullets: HIGH POWER: Top CREE LED chips with 60W per pair. Cool White 6000K. High luminous efficacy. 200% brighter than your stock Halogen headlights.The latest technology to ensure a perfect beam pattern without any dark spots or foggy light.
AIR COOLING: Whole aluminum housing 7,000 RPM Powerful TurboCool fan to ensures your LED Headlight bulbs Over 50,000 hrs of brilliant continuous light.

EASY INSTALLATION: Can be installed in 20 mins. plug and play. These bulbs are CanBUS-Ready and will work with most vehicle's computer system without error. If you are not sure whether the right, please contact us before purchase.
LONGER LIFE: Last more than 50,000 Hours. Works in any conditions! Rugged housing, fan works even in extreme situations.
BUY WITH CONFIDENCE: We offer lifetime support.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars5,289 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
